sections.heading: What is 〜ほうがいい?
sections.content:
〜ほうがいい is used to give advice or recommendations, meaning "should," "had better," or "it would be better to." It's more direct than といい but not as strong as べき.

休んだほうがいい "You should rest" / "You had better rest" 医者に行ったほうがいいですよ "You should go to the doctor" 早く寝たほうがいい "You should sleep early"

children.heading: Pattern: Verb た-form + ほうがいい(です)
children.content: | Verb | た-form | + ほうがいい | | ------ | ------- | ---------------- | | 見る | 見た | 見たほうがいい | | 食べる | 食べた | 食べたほうがいい | | 来る | 来た | 来たほうがいい | | する | した | したほうがいい | | 行く | 行った | 行ったほうがいい | | 読む | 読んだ | 読んだほうがいい |

children.heading: Negative advice (ない form)
children.content: 食べないほうがいい "You shouldn't eat" 行かないほうがいい "You shouldn't go" Use ない-form, NOT なかった!

children.heading: Positive advice (should do)
children.content: もっと勉強したほうがいいよ "You should study more" 医者に行ったほうがいいですよ "You should go to the doctor" 謝ったほうがいい "You should apologize"

children.heading: Negative advice (shouldn't do)
children.content: そんなに食べないほうがいい "You shouldn't eat that much" 行かないほうがいいよ "You shouldn't go" 無理しないほうがいいですよ "You shouldn't overdo it"

children.heading: Casual: ほうがいい
children.content: 休んだほうがいいよ "You should rest" Use with friends

children.heading: Polite: ほうがいいです
children.content: 休んだほうがいいですよ "You should rest" Standard polite form

children.heading: Softer: ほうがいいと思います
children.content: 休んだほうがいいと思います "I think you should rest" Adds と思う to soften

children.heading: Very soft: ほうがいいんじゃないですか
children.content: 休んだほうがいいんじゃないですか "Don't you think you should rest?" Most tentative

children.heading: Example 1: Health Advice
children.content: A: 熱があるんだ "I have a fever" B: 今日は会社を休んだほうがいいよ "You should take the day off from work" A: そうだね。そうする "You're right. I'll do that"

children.heading: Example 2: Study Advice
children.content: A: 試験、心配だな "I'm worried about the exam" B: もっと勉強したほうがいいんじゃない？ "Don't you think you should study more?" A: うん、頑張るよ "Yeah, I'll do my best"

children.heading: Example 3: Relationship Advice
children.content: A: 彼氏とまた喧嘩しちゃった "I had another fight with my boyfriend" B: ちゃんと話し合ったほうがいいですよ "You should talk it through properly" A: そうですね "You're right"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using dictionary form
children.content: Wrong: 行くほうがいい ❌ Right: 行ったほうがいい ✓ "You should go" Must use た-form for positive!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using past tense for negative
children.content: Wrong: 食べなかったほうがいい ❌ Right: 食べないほうがいい ✓ "You shouldn't eat" Use ない-form, not なかった!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Too direct with strangers
children.content: Too direct: 休んだほうがいい (to stranger) ⚠️ Better: 休まれたほうがいいかもしれませんね ✓ "Perhaps you should rest" Add softeners with strangers!

children.heading: Positive (should do)
children.content: 行ったほうがいい - You should go 食べたほうがいい - You should eat 勉強したほうがいい - You should study Use た-form

children.heading: Negative (shouldn't do)
children.content: 行かないほうがいい - You shouldn't go 食べないほうがいい - You shouldn't eat 勉強しないほうがいい - You shouldn't study Use ない-form

children.heading: Health advice
children.content: 医者に行ったほうがいいよ "You should go to the doctor" もっと寝たほうがいいです "You should sleep more" 運動したほうがいい "You should exercise" タバコをやめたほうがいいですよ "You should quit smoking"

children.heading: Study/work advice
children.content: もっと勉強したほうがいい "You should study more" 先生に相談したほうがいいよ "You should consult the teacher" 早く始めたほうがいいです "You should start early" 計画を立てたほうがいい "You should make a plan"

children.heading: Relationship advice
children.content: 謝ったほうがいいよ "You should apologize" 正直に話したほうがいい "You should talk honestly" 別れたほうがいいんじゃない？ "Don't you think you should break up?"

children.heading: Safety warnings
children.content: 行かないほうがいいよ "You shouldn't go" 触らないほうがいい "You shouldn't touch it" 信じないほうがいいです "You shouldn't believe it"

children.heading: Adding と思う (I think)
children.content: 休んだほうがいいと思います "I think you should rest" Makes it your opinion, not a command

children.heading: Adding かもしれない (might)
children.content: 医者に行ったほうがいいかもしれません "You might want to go to the doctor" Very soft suggestion

children.heading: Adding んじゃない？ (don't you think?)
children.content: 謝ったほうがいいんじゃない？ "Don't you think you should apologize?" Asking their opinion

children.heading: Adding よ for emphasis
children.content: 早く帰ったほうがいいよ "You really should go home early" Friendly emphasis

children.heading: といい (softest)
children.content: 休むといいですよ "It would be good if you rested" Gentle wish/hope

children.heading: たらどう (casual suggestion)
children.content: 休んだらどう？ "How about resting?" Casual advice

children.heading: ほうがいい (recommendation)
children.content: 休んだほうがいい "You should rest" Clear recommendation

children.heading: べき (strongest)
children.content: 休むべきだ "You must rest" Strong obligation

children.heading: Use ほうがいい when
children.content: ✓ Giving clear advice ✓ Health and safety matters ✓ Friend asking for advice ✓ Concerned recommendation ✓ Practical suggestions

children.heading: Don't use ほうがいい when
children.content: ✗ Speaking to superiors (too direct) ✗ Very sensitive topics (too blunt) ✗ When advice wasn't asked for ✗ With people you don't know well

children.heading: Agreeing
children.content: そうだね "You're right" そうします "I'll do that" 分かった "Got it" そうしようと思います "I was thinking of doing that"

children.heading: Disagreeing politely
children.content: でも、ちょっと難しいんだよね "But it's a bit difficult" そうかもしれないけど... "That might be true, but..." 考えてみます "I'll think about it"

children.heading: At work (to colleague)
children.content: 上司に報告したほうがいいんじゃない？ "Don't you think you should report to the boss?" 資料を確認したほうがいいですよ "You should check the documents"

children.heading: To family
children.content: 早く寝たほうがいいよ "You should sleep early" 野菜も食べたほうがいい "You should eat vegetables too"

children.heading: To friends
children.content: あいつとは付き合わないほうがいいよ "You shouldn't date that guy" もっと自信を持ったほうがいいよ "You should have more confidence"

children.heading: When it's important
children.content: すぐに病院に行ったほうがいい "You should go to the hospital right away" 今日中に終わらせたほうがいいですよ "You should finish it today" 早く決めたほうがいい "You should decide quickly"

children.heading: Explaining why
children.content: 雨が降るから、傘を持って行ったほうがいい "It's going to rain, so you should take an umbrella" 試験があるんだから、勉強したほうがいいよ "You have an exam, so you should study" 危ないから、行かないほうがいい "It's dangerous, so you shouldn't go"

children.heading: If conditions
children.content: 時間があるなら、見たほうがいい "If you have time, you should watch it" お金がないなら、買わないほうがいいよ "If you don't have money, you shouldn't buy it"

children.heading: Should have done
children.content: 勉強したほうがよかった "I should have studied" (regret) 行かないほうがよかった "I shouldn't have gone" (regret) Uses past tense よかった

sections.heading: Making Lists of Advice
sections.content: 早く寝たほうがいいし、野菜も食べたほうがいい "You should sleep early, and you should eat vegetables too" Using し to connect multiple advice

children.heading: Basic
children.content: もっと休んだほうがいいよ "You should rest more" 医者に行ったほうがいいです "You should go to the doctor" タバコをやめたほうがいい "You should quit smoking"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: そんなに無理しないほうがいいんじゃない？ "Don't you think you shouldn't push yourself so hard?" 試験の前にちゃんと復習したほうがいいと思います "I think you should review properly before the exam" 彼に正直に話したほうがいいですよ "You should talk to him honestly"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: その仕事、条件があまり良くないから、もう一度よく考えたほうがいいと思いますよ "That job doesn't have very good conditions, so I think you should think about it carefully once more" 体調が悪いなら、無理して会社に行かないほうがいいんじゃないですか "If you're not feeling well, don't you think you shouldn't force yourself to go to work?" 今はまだ決断する時期じゃないと思うから、もう少し待ったほうがいいかもしれません "I don't think it's time to decide yet, so you might want to wait a bit longer"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜べき - Should/must (stronger) 〜たらどう - How about (casual) 〜といい - It would be good if (softer) 〜ないほうがいい - Shouldn't (negative advice) 〜たほうがよかった - Should have (regret) Giving advice - Advice patterns
